result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam C Smith

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Adam C Smith
Current: 2000 DeKoven Ave, Racine, WI 53406 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 816 Melvin Ave, Racine, WI 53402

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No violent contact with the victim M.W.T(person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

10:18 AM Defendant Adam C Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Claude-Allan Milhomme in court for Adam C Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matter is scheduled on Defense's Motion to modify bond.
Defense is requesting that bond be modified to a $250 signature bond.
State would ask for a cash bond in the amount of $500 cash with a signature bond.
BTC: Modify bond to $1500 signature bond, all conditions remain, modify conditions to no violent contact with M.W.T., matter adjourned.
Bail/bond hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Deft's Notice of Motion to Modify Bond
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
Defendant requests a lower bail and/or a signature bond.

2:36 PM Defendant Adam C Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Adam C Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
